text: A little monk was so used to performing miracles that the prior forbade him to exercise his talent. The little monk obeyed; but seeing a poor mason fall from the roof, he doubted between the desire to save his life and holy obedience. He ordered the mason to stay in the air until further notice, and ran quickly to tell his prior the status of the situation. The prior forgave him for the sin he had committed by beginning a miracle without his permission, but allowed him to finish it off on the condition that it did not continue and not repeat itself. Finished Philosophical Dictionary, 1764
title: Milagro
author: nan Voltaire
